There's a pretty standard format for JUnit XML output.  You've
probably see=
n it: there's a <testsuite> root element containing
zero-or-more <testcase>=
 elements, each of which may contain a
<failure> or <error> element.  (Ther=
e's also a <properties> element
with zero-or-more <property> elements.)  A =
lot of tools know how to
read this format and report on it, including at le=
ast Ant, Maven,
Cruise Control, Hudson, Bamboo, Eclipse and IntelliJ IDEA.
=

Is this XML standardized anywhere in a DTD or XML Schema or something?

If=
 there isn't a standard, could we go about making a standard and
blessing i=
t?  (Perhaps JUnit 4.5 could include an XMLReporter that
could be a referen=
ce implementation.)

In particular, I'm curious to know how one would repre=
sent that a test
has been ignored in "standard" JUnit XML.

-Dan
